BNC User Reference Guide

<quote>

quote (quotation) contains a phrase or passage attributed by the narrator or author to some agency external to the text.
Class model.qLike model.divPart att.rendered
Declaration 
element quote { att.rendered.attribute.rend, ( bibl?, model.divPart+, bibl? ) }
Attributes
(Global attributes and those inherited from [att.rendered ] )
Example
 <quote
xmlns:xaira="http://www.xaira.org/ns/1.0/spec"
xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
xmlns:rng="http://relaxng.org/ns/structure/1.0">
  <p>
   <s n="1426">
    <w c5="NN1-NP0" hw="thrift" pos="SUBST">Thrift </w>
    <w c5="VHZ" hw="have" pos="VERB">has </w>
    <w c5="VVN" hw="go" pos="VERB">gone </w>
    <mw c5="PRP">
     <w c5="AVP" hw="out" pos="ADV">out </w>
     <w c5="PRF" hw="of" pos="PREP">of </w>
    </mw>
    <w c5="NN1" hw="fashion" pos="SUBST">fashion</w>
    <c c5="PUN">.</c>
   </s>
  </p>
 </quote>
Note

Any bibliographic source or reference provided for the quotation may be included within the quote element.
;
Module core
